perturbation.original_text: This Intellectual Property Agreement (the "Agreement"), is entered into as of November 20, 2007 (the "Effective Date"), by and between Morgan Stanley & Co. Incorporated, a Delaware corporation ("MS") and MSCI Inc., a Delaware corporation ("MSCI"). (MS and MSCI individually referred to as a "Party" and collectively as the "Parties").
perturbation.changed_text: This Intellectual Property Agreement (the "Agreement"), is entered into as of November 20, 2007 (the "Effective Date"), by and between Morgan Stanley & Co. Incorporated, a Delaware corporation ("MS") and MSCI Inc., a Delaware corporation ("MSCI"). (MS and MSCI individually referred to as a "Party" and collectively as the "Entities").
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Parties' to 'Entities' when referring to MS and MSCI introduces ambiguity. Throughout the contract, 'Party' refers to each individual entity, while 'Parties' refers to both collectively. By changing the collective term to 'Entities', it creates uncertainty about whether provisions referring to 'Parties' apply jointly or severally.

perturbation.original_text:
MS hereby grants (subject to any existing third party contractual obligations) to MSCI a non-exclusive, perpetual, irrevocable, world- wide, royalty-free license for MSCI to use, modify, copy, create derivative works of and sublicense, for any business purpose, the MS Licensed Materials.     2.2 MSCI Grant.

MSCI hereby grants (subject to any existing third party contractual obligations) to MS a non-exclusive, perpetual, irrevocable, world- wide, royalty-free license for MS to use, modify, copy, create derivative works of and sublicense, for any business purpose, the MSCI Licensed Materials.
perturbation.changed_text:
MS hereby grants (subject to any existing third party contractual obligations) to MSCI a non-exclusive, perpetual, irrevocable, world- wide, royalty-free license for MSCI to use, modify, copy, create derivative works of and sublicense, for any business purpose, the MS Licensed Materials.     2.2 MSCI Grant.

MSCI hereby grants (subject to any existing third party contractual obligations) to MS a non-exclusive, perpetual, revocable, world- wide, royalty-free license for MS to use, modify, copy, create derivative works of and sublicense, for any business purpose, the MSCI Licensed Materials.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'irrevocable' to 'revocable' in the MSCI grant creates a direct contradiction with the MS grant, where the license is explicitly stated as irrevocable. This introduces significant uncertainty regarding the nature and duration of the MSCI license. The original contract ensures a long-term and reliable agreement, while the change allows license termination, thus creating disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
To MSCI:

MSCl Inc. 88 Pine Street New York, New York 10005 Attn: General Counsel Facsimile: (212) 804-2906

or to such other addresses or telecopy numbers as may be specified by like notice to the other party. All such notices, requests and other communications shall be deemed given, (a) when delivered in person or by courier or a courier services, (b) if sent by facsimile transmission (receipt confirmed) on a business day prior to 5 p.m. in the place of receipt, on the date of transmission (or, if sent after 5 p.m., on the following business day) or (c) if mailed by certified mail (return receipt requested), on the date specified on the return receipt.
perturbation.changed_text:
To MSCI:

MSCl Inc. 88 Pine Street New York, New York 10005 Attn: Legal Department Facsimile: (212) 804-2906

or to such other addresses or telecopy numbers as may be specified by like notice to the other party. All such notices, requests and other communications shall be deemed given, (a) when delivered in person or by courier or a courier services, (b) if sent by electronic mail (receipt confirmed) on a business day prior to 5 p.m. in the place of receipt, on the date of transmission (or, if sent after 5 p.m., on the following business day) or (c) if mailed by certified mail (return receipt requested), on the date specified on the return receipt.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'General Counsel' to 'Legal Department' and 'facsimile transmission' to 'electronic mail' introduces ambiguity and potential for miscommunication. The original text specifies a particular individual (General Counsel) as the contact point. Changing it to a department creates uncertainty. The original specifies using facsimile and the changed text now specifies email.
